main event: A white streak was observed traveling through the sky and making a right angle turn before disappearing into a fog bank in Scullville, New Jersey on January 27, 1950.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about half an hour, and the phenomena appeared to be ascending at about a sixty degree angle.
The object did not disappear suddenly or move with high speed, but instead, faded gradually.
It had the appearances and indications of a vapor trail made by a high-flying aircraft.
The lapse of time between sighting and disappearance was consistent with known technical authorities, leading to the conclusion that it was a vapor trail.
No further investigation of this phenomena was considered advisable due to a lack of sufficient technical data and only one sighting.
sighted object: white streak traveling through the sky
